title: Art and Picture Book Activity: Triptych Window
copy: What colors, shapes, and patterns do you see in this window? How would the world outside appear if you were looking through it? Use the read aloud link for “The Hello, Goodbye Window” by Norton Juster, create your very own window with colored pencils or crayons, and imagine what’s happening outside. Designed especially for young learners, this resource offers creative ideas for looking at and responding to art together.   Illinois Early Learning Standards: Learning Standard 2.D Establish personal connection with books. Learning Standard 17.A Explore environments and where people live.
